settings.scientific_papers: Alterations in Gut Microbiome Composition and Function in Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Increased Probiotic Abundance with Daily Supplementation
The Infant Microbiome Development: Mom Matters
settings.paragraph:
The NIH has concluded that C-section and antibiotic use on infants increases disease burden on children, especially if they are formula fed post birth. This along with the previous article set a paradigm where probiotics can enable a formula fed baby to grow up healthy without risk of disease burden.
Trends in Molecular Medicine

settings.scientific_papers: Effects of probiotics on child growth: a systematic review
settings.paragraph:
Most studies show that probiotics are important for early child growth. Sun Genomics has these strains and can understand the mode of nutrition your child is in to best help them.
Journal of Health, Population and Nutrition
